channel.title: Another note about viruses
channel.description:
Some of you may post "ZOMG TROJAN VIRUS DOWNLOAD HAXXX"
You then post a virus scan [b]not[/b] picking up infected java files, but EXE files such as shopmaker.exe
The programmes themselves are not viruses, but are picked up as them for whatever reason.
If you still feel uncomfortable with these so called viruses, remove the .EXE files.
~bill
Edit: It has also come to my attention that people are posting fake virus scans or scanning the wrong link. This then triggers the next person to say "VIRUS"!!!
Unless proven, aka by scanning the [b]correct[/b] link and by one of the many great online scanners, dont believe them.
[size=50pt]ITS NOT POSSIBLE FOR THERE TO BE A VIRUS IN JAVA FILES![/size]
End of story.

item.title: Another note about viruses
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

These type of threads are not allowed, if people wish to learn more about viruses they can contact another member.

Read full topic

item.description:
@cows1471 wrote:

[quote=“Lewis), post:5, topic:323949”][quote author=cows1471 link=topic=420348.msg3087785#msg3087785 date=1262640765]

Wannabe sticky, thanks for your help but it’s common sense.

Stfu.

EHm nice but wrong section.

No, i intended for it to be here.
[/quote]

There is no section for these things, mr wannabe sticky…And isn’t it you that called me a wannabe mod? [quote]
A Moderator doesn’t need to know Java or any sort of language. They just need courage to stand up for what’s right.[/quote][/quote]

i actually lol’d irl

GTFO of this thread you fucking dork.

Read full topic
